I mail stuff to my family in the US from Japan a few times a year. You donâ€™t want to be too specific on the customs forms. If you explicitly say â€œKinder Eggsâ€ Or â€œToblerone Bar,â€ things are more likely to get jacked / removed. It sucks, but there seems to be a lot of dishonest ppl in the mail system. Usually I write: Chocolates, Chips, Coffee, Crackers...things like that. 

Fresh fruits & veggies are a no go (unless you have a specific vendor license I think b/c there are companies who do like fruit of the month). This is due to the risk of introducing bugs, parasites, & fungus that can destroy local crops. 
Alcohol is a no go b/c itâ€™s considered a hazardous material (of course thereâ€™s always an exception or ppl who are really good at hiding it).

I do send bottles sodas & canned coffees. In 5yrs Iâ€™ve only had one package where a can opened. I just wrap all liquids in a plastic bag & tape it shut just in case something explodes. 

 
https://www.usps.com/international/shipping-restrictions.htm

We went solely out of curiosity. â€œWhat is it about this place that draws ppl in?â€ Itâ€™s peaceful but also very somber. I think the somber aspect is a combination of the conditions (very dense growth & damp from the rain) & itâ€™s reputation. We both believe in the paranormal but also skeptical/ logical. We read the basics but tried not to read any personal blogs so our experience wouldnâ€™t be tainted. 

The unease increased for us as we were trying to get back. we heard a loud crash & looked over just in time to see a huge (like at least 50ft long) tree limb coming crashing down. It was probably 100-150ft to our left. That was pretty â€œwtf!â€ No other branches or limbs had fallen that we were aware of while there. It was just too close for comfort. Shortly after that, is when we had trouble finding our markers.  

We did come across a few areas where some one had sat & hopefully, just thought for awhile. That was a gut punch. Like ooooohhh damn ğŸ˜ğŸ¥º. We really didnâ€™t think we were going to find anything. 

Is it haunted? I wouldnâ€™t be surprised. If thereâ€™s a place that would truly be haunted (& not just due to fearful imagination) this would definitely be in the top 5 for me. I currently live in Okinawa Japan. I love the local history & folklore. I love hiking & exploring the old shrines. Thereâ€™s been a few times it feels like Iâ€™m being watched or can sense something not of the normal critter variety, closing in. Or just simply get the â€œDonâ€™t do it, Donâ€™t go thereâ€ vibe. 

I believe thereâ€™s a reason so many cultures have ghost, woodland spirits, gods, boogeyman, etc. stories. A lot are able to be rationalized away with science & logic. But thereâ€™s some that canâ€™t be. I donâ€™t think these things simply vanished; they just live where most humans donâ€™t go.

Agreed. Friend & I went this summer after hiking Mt. Fuji. We didnâ€™t find the main trail head until the end of our trip & it was closed (surprisingly a lot harder & secretive then we thought given its infamy. But not surprising either). 

We did a day hike (in another part of the forest) & it was just....off like you said. There were a few times when it was just dead silence, like everything sounded 100yards away & 5ft ahead the normal forest sounds started again. It was unsettling.  We purposely strayed off the trail out of morbid curiosity. We used hot pink ribbons to mark our path & tried to maintain a fairly straight path. On our way back, we lost our trail. One of us would stay at the last marker, while the other went ahead to find the next one (so there was a point of reference & we didnâ€™t have to backtrack). Only after it was found would we take it down & meet up. For about 20mins my friend wandered around looking for the next ribbon. Some odd things occurred during that time. 

We tried to test our nerves & hike at night. We got maybe 7mins in with flashlights & could just feel the oppression of the darkness. We could no longer see or hear the road, like it had disappeared altogether. At the same time we spoke up & called the night hike over. There was just â€˜somethingâ€™ in the air & we wanted to get out ASAP. Neither of us are easily scared. I would go back in the day, but a night hike is off the table.

But did we really used to be great at correcting things or was it just the majority being vocal & then those who didnâ€™t want to get caught up in the frenzy â€œcorrectingâ€ emotion? What dictates which emotion is correct? 

Is it really worth anyoneâ€™s time & energy to get passionate/ factual/ logical/ or angry with anyoneâ€™s comment the donâ€™t agree with? 
Do people really not have better things to do than yell into the void & get annoyed when they didnâ€™t get a response they liked? 

My point was- if â€˜youâ€™ look at every single good or negative thing that all of humanity does on a daily basis, odds are â€˜youâ€™ (the reader) will see more negative than good.  Negative gets repeated way more often than good. In summation- ppl as a whole (humanity) is going to seem like absolute shit, but that doesnâ€™t mean all ppl are bad.

No youâ€™re not alone. The media certainly doesnâ€™t help. Itâ€™s non stop 24/7. Shit has always existed in every country but now we just hear about it all.the.time!  Then of course everyone has to have an opinion on the â€˜matters.â€™ Some ppl are much more vocal & passionate about it than others. What can you actually change? Can you do your part to recycle more, use re-useable bags, less one use products, not murder ppl, volunteer where/ when possible, etc. Do you have money & the influence to do more? Are you doing more? 

Personally I banned politics & religion (seem to the hot button topics) on my social media. I donâ€™t talk about it & I donâ€™t engage with it. Iâ€™m not oblivious. I know the world is shit & whatâ€™s going on, but I donâ€™t feel the need to read/ know about every little change in whatever is the â€œitâ€ topic of the week. I got too much personal shit to worry about than to be burden with all the ugly of humanity. 
A person is smart & kind, but people as a whole are dumb & malicious.

Grid lined paper (like graphing paper) is a great way to practice writing in. It helps you maintain a consistent size / angle for your characters. Angle isnâ€™t as big of a deal in hiragana, but it makes a difference when writing katakana & kanji. It can completely change the character if written improperly :)

Iâ€™m not gonna say it was or wasnâ€™t real, but mass hysteria is a real thing. If enough ppl believe something, they start to feed off each other. I had a somewhat similar experience with a church â€œcleansingâ€ retreat. We did the whole talk about Jesus, letting go our sins, etc. watched the Passion of the Christ (just the scene where they torture & kill Jesus), & then made all of us close our eyes & pray for forgiveness. They positioned ppl around the doors & told us not to open our eyes. They said weâ€™d hear ppl talking in tongues & so on. The more they â€˜preparedâ€™ us, the more suspect it got. It was weird. Like â€œwhat the fuck is going on?!â€ craziness. Other ppl started wailing & screaming gibberish. It probably lasted 30 mins or so & then they said â€œokâ€ & just like that the hysteria died down. I had a hard time  â€œfeelingâ€ anything & just made myself cry so our group leader would stop talking to me. 

In my experience, Iâ€™m not convinced there was the â€œHoly Spiritâ€ or â€œdemons.â€ I think they just gathered a lot of women who had daily sadness & were, well gullible (myself included), & swayed our emotional responses. 
Idk, it just seems convenient the â€œdemonsâ€ prevented him & the preacher was near by. Like the church ppl knew damn well what they were going to talk about & if it was always such a challenge for the possessed guy to talk- why didnâ€™t his wife just say everything instead of him instigating the â€œdemonsâ€? I admit Iâ€™m jaded when it comes to organize religion, but just food for thought.

I do, but itâ€™s definitely more than just needing to rant at times. I worry about his mental health as well. Iâ€™ve seen the look on his face, the weight on his shoulder when Iâ€™m in a â€œlowâ€ place. I know he will try to take it all on but he canâ€™t. I worry that heâ€™ll end up in the same place & I wonâ€™t be able to support him & then what? Weâ€™re just both hot mess depressed/ anxious & angry ppl feeding off each other? Nah I grew up with that & do not want to live with that again. 

Like lately Iâ€™ve been internally spiraling: my friends moved, but we still have a group chat on messenger that we use. I FINALLY got a surgery that Iâ€™ve been trying to get for a few years that will hopefully resolve a lot of female issues (this was not an elective surgery). They all knew the date of the surgery. I talked to them the morning of on my way there. 

Itâ€™s been 2 weeks & not one of them has asked how it went or how Iâ€™m doing. Iâ€™ve been silent on messenger as well. I havenâ€™t talked about it on FB, so thereâ€™s literally no updates from me. Iâ€™m hurt & angry, but mostly hurt. Thought we were a pretty tight group but no one seems to notice Iâ€™ve fallen off the grid. Yeah every one is busy & has their own things going on but 2 weeks?! Ppl I hardly know (in comparison to them) that I mentioned the surgery in passing to have checked on me! 
Iâ€™m so hurt, Iâ€™ve chosen not to talk in the chat so I donâ€™t say something childish. 
From there- my stupid brain has thought of every slight, every time I got left out, every half hearted appreciation speech, etc & just keeps dragging it up. Iâ€™ve talked to my hubs about the issue with my friends, but not the dwelling part. That, that part is something deeper & I know that needs to be worked on in therapy.

I get what yâ€™all are saying, I do. But itâ€™s also about knowing whatâ€™s fair to put on our support systems & admitting to ourselves when we have a deeper issue. More than that- itâ€™s about taking responsibility & addressing those issues instead of letting them fester. Like if you have a hole in the crotch of your jeans you know it needs to be repaired. If you ignore it or only complain about it, itâ€™s just going to get worse over time. Some times patching it works. Other times you have to admit itâ€™s time to replace them. 
Thatâ€™s where Iâ€™m at. Itâ€™s time to replace this negative â€˜abandonedâ€™ feeling. I need to work it out & learn how to let go. So back to therapy it is :).

The first limited (non- chocolate) flavor was Strawberry released in 2000. Limited release flavors became really popular around 2010. 

To date- according to Nestle Japan, they have  â€œreleased over 350 varieties of KitKats & regional flavorsâ€ (this is kind of confusing as it does not mean 350 different flavors. Some of the â€œvarietiesâ€ are different forms of KitKats like KitKat sticks or mini big bites, in addition to the regular 2 finger bars).

Iâ€™ve had a hard time finding a complete list of all the flavors (even the Nestle Japan website doesnâ€™t do it -_-) so...just from what I know of, Iâ€™d guess the actual # of flavors is closer to 250-275.

KitKats were originally created in the United Kingdom. Eventually the producing company was bought by the Swiss Nestle company (Nestle produces KitKat in Japan). 

Nestle US is owned by the Hershey company. So yes- technically different companies :)

If after cleaning your machine you still have a problem, â€œstripâ€ your clothes.  We do this for our workout clothes & towels when they still have a lingering musk.  Fill the machine or bathtub with scalding hot water (I have to use an electric kettle to add the water to my machine as it doesnâ€™t get hot enough). Add 1-2 cups white vinegar. Throw the clothes in & let them sit for about 2 hours. Then wash as normal. It will kill the lingering bacteria & remove any soap/ softener residue thatâ€™s clinging to the fibers. 
Iâ€™m also team â€œhang outside to dry or in ventilated spaceâ€ when possible. Some things like jeans, we throw in the dryer on low to make sure it doesnâ€™t have a chance to â€˜mildewâ€™.
